channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11573] Report age on eviction
item.description:
From the parent issue, Todd reminds us of the old Jim Gray '5 minute rule' on whether to cache.

In master, we were reporting age only it was the inactionable inverse of 'how long blocks are staying in the cache'.

Let me add to our cache stats a histogram of age on eviction and change the UI reporting so it is age at eviction (plus stddev). The JSON version has percentiles (and if wanted, the old age report of age of items in cache).

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: In UI, show eviction mean age w/ stdev in stats tab. If blockcaches > 1, show eviction mean age+stddev per cache. This stuff only populated on cache eviction. Reports made when you ask for them. Not metrics (yet).
Looks like this (the mean and stddev only show up if non-null because combinedblockcache does not update its own stats when evictions... calls through to hosted block caches).

Here is what the JSON looks like:

Notice new ageAtEviction and further down, ageInCache:




  [ {

  "stats" : {

    "iohitsPerSecond" : 59,

    "iotimePerHit" : 0.04556650295853615,

      "max" : 1.74233091E11,

      "98thPercentile" : 1.2401433921999997E11,

  "dataCount" : 0,

  "dataSize" : 0,

  "count" : 84

} ]

v2 adds printing out age only if non-zero in UI (some 'blockcaches' will always be zero).

Nick Dimiduk You good w/ this boss? Age-at-eviction time is more actionable than what I had previous (age-in-cache). The latter is still there if you JSON (only generated when report is made) but the focus is put instead on the new actionable age-at-eviction.

Looks like you missed adding some files to your patch.

This looks really nice! If we're thinking in terms of minutes, maybe ms isn't the best choice of unit for displaying this info.

Thanks Nick Dimiduk. I'll take that as a +1.

v3 changes age to seconds from ms.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 1 warning messages.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ <& bc_l; bc = bcs == null? null: bcs.length <= 1? null: bcs[1]; name = "L2"; evictions = evictions; &>
+ <td><% String.format("%,d", (long)(ageAtEvictionSnapshot.getMean()/(1000000 * 1000))) %></td>
+<p><b>Too many blocks!</b> Listing out the first <% cbsbfSnapshot.getMax() %> only (hbase.ui.blockcache.by.file.max)</p>
+<%if bcv.equals("file") %><& bc_by_file; cbsbf = cbsbf; &><%else>[ <% BlockCacheUtil.toJSON(bc) %>, <% BlockCacheUtil.toJSON(cbsbf) %> ]</%if>

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.TestCacheConfig
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.bucket.TestBucketCache
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestHeapMemoryManager
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.TestBlockCacheReporting
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.TestLruBlockCache
